title: Mars landing: Photo shows Perseverance about to touch down
description: Nasa releases an astonishing image of its new Mars robot taken just moments before touchdown.

title: Myanmar: Protesting against a military coup... with shallots
description: People are showing their opposition to Myanmar's military coup with shallots, shoe-tying and bicycle repairs.

title: Human damage done to more than half of all rivers worldwide
description: New research analysed almost 2,500 rivers and has found human activity has had an impact on rivers.

title: Ben Boulos: ‘Why I changed my name from Bland’
description: The name helped his family escape prejudice. But for the BBC’s Ben Boulos, it is time for a change.

title: It's A Sin: The real women who cared
description: The women who helped friends and relations in the Aids crisis when the disease was still a taboo.

title: Swansea blitz: Childhood memories of 'bombing horror', 80 years on
description: The Three Nights' Blitz began on 19 February 1941, killing 230 and injuring nearly 400.

title: What does Princess Latifa case mean for British sport?
description: The accusations against Dubai's ruler leaves British horse racing facing some uncomfortable questions.

title: How Norway is offering drug-free treatment to people with psychosis
description: People with psychosis are usually given powerful medication - in Norway they can now choose to go drug-free.
